text: {"answer":"D","reasoning":"i is incorrect because classical Roman law did not generally require a fixed half-and-half split between finder and landowner for treasure; ii is incorrect because legal sociology is primarily descriptive/empirical rather than prescribing normative ends; iii is incorrect because in concrete/incidental review an unconstitutional provision is typically not applied and may be set aside, and Swiss review mechanisms do not fit the absolute claim that only the administrative decision is repealed; iv is incorrect because under Swiss civil procedure the court can (and generally must) refuse evidence that is irrelevant or already proven (antizipierte Beweisw√ºrdigung); v is incorrect because the Act of Mediation (1803) ended the Helvetic Republic and established the Swiss Confederation under mediation, not founded the Helvetic Republic."}
